name: NSUnarchiver
desc: A decoder that restores data from an archive.

items.name: init?(forReadingWith: Data)
items.desc: Returns an NSUnarchiver object initialized to read an archive from a given data object.

items.name: class func unarchiveObject(with: Data) -> Any?
items.desc: Decodes and returns the object archived in a given NSData object.

items.name: class func unarchiveObject(withFile: String) -> Any?
items.desc: Decodes and returns the object archived in the file path.

items.name: var isAtEnd: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver has reached the end of the encoded data while decoding.

items.name: var systemVersion: UInt32
items.desc: The system version number in effect when the archive was created.

items.name: class func classNameDecoded(forArchiveClassName: String) -> String
items.desc: Returns the name of the class used when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is a given name.

items.name: class func decodeClassName(String, asClassName: String)
items.desc: Instructs instances of NSUnarchiver to use the class with a given name when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is another given name.

items.name: func classNameDecoded(forArchiveClassName: String) -> String
items.desc: Returns the name of the class that will be used when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is a given name.

items.name: func decodeClassName(String, asClassName: String)
items.desc: Instructs the receiver to use the class with a given name when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is another given name.

items.name: func replace(Any, with: Any)
items.desc: Causes the receiver to substitute one given object for another whenever the latter is extracted from the archive.
